findings.interpretation: Day side is warm but not sufficient alone to prove a bare surface
Non-zero redistribution is favored, indicating heat transport beyond bare-rock reradiation
Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits, consistent with low reflectivity

findings.metric: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate
findings.interpretation: Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption, supporting CO2-rich scenarios

findings.metric: Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere)
findings.interpretation: Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products than no-atmosphere models

findings.metric: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval family
findings.interpretation: Moderate-pressure atmosphere family remains plausible, not ruled out by current data

controls_or_null_results.statement: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior.
O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data.
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions remain significant.
